measured_by: choices between monetary lotteries (gain/loss binary or Likert tasks)
justification: "We created 64 lottery choices ... participants had to choose between two alternatives" – the pattern of choosing the safer vs. riskier lottery is used to quantify risk seeking or aversion.

measured_by: β parameter estimated from Luce’s choice rule / soft-max function
justification: "In stochastic models ... the β parameter is typically interpreted as a measure of consistency of choice ... we will use the latter interpretation, treating beta as a measure of sensitivity to the differences between alternatives."

measured_by: α parameter of the power utility function u(x)=x^α
justification: "The α parameter captures the curvature of the utility function u(x) ... A concave utility function leads to risk aversion."
